name.en: Special Topics on Microwave Remote Sensing of the Atmosphere Ⅱ
name.ch: 大氣微波遙測特論 Ⅱ

department.en: Department of Space Science and Engineering

goal.en: This course is designed to present the state-of-the-art techniques and advancements in (passive and active) microwave remote sensing of the atmosphere and land surface. A collection of monographs that cover the microwave remote sensing theory, and most mature and representative applications are provided. Besides, the practical part aims to improve the application and interpretation of microwave observations and products in daily meteorological and environmental monitoring and forecasting activities.
goal.ch: 本課程主要在介紹大氣和地表（被動和主動）微波遙測的最新技術和進展，本課程收集了涵蓋微波遙測理論的專著和最成熟和最具代表性的應用。另外在實際應用方面，包括在日常氣象和環境監測與預報活動中改善微波觀測和產品的應用和解釋。

content.en:
1. Introduction to Radar systems (4 weeks – 12 hours) – Introduction to radar systems, The basics of radar, Radar equation, surveillance from of radar equation, radar losses, propagation effects on radar performance, atmospheric attenuation, reflection off of Earth’s surface, over-the-horizon diffraction, and atmospheric refraction.
2. Target radar cross section and Detection of Signals in Noise and Pulse Compression (2 weeks – 6 hours) – What are typical levels of radar cross section? On what do these depend? What contributes to radar cross section? What are the scattering mechanisms? What are typical signature contributors? How can target radar cross section be determined? (measurement, prediction), detection of target echoes in noise (basic concepts, integration of pulses, fluctuating targets issues, adaptive thresholding techniques), and pulse compression.
3. Radar antennas, Radar clutter and chaff (2 weeks – 6 hours) – Antennas introduction, fundamental antenna concepts, reflector antennas, phased array antennas, ground clutter, sea clutter, rain, chaff, birds and insects.
4. Signal Processing - MTI and Pulse Doppler Techniques, Tracking and Parameter Estimation, Transmitters and Receivers (2 weeks – 6 hours) – Moving Target Indicator (MTI) techniques, pulse Doppler processing techniques, range estimation, angle estimation (monopulse), estimation performance, velocity (Doppler) estimation, radar transmitter, radar waveform generator and receiver, radar transmitter/receiver architecture.
5. Understanding and using Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) data (3 weeks – 9 hours) – Brief history, fundamentals of EM waves, polarization, combination of waves; How microwaves interact with surface features, surface roughness, moisture content, vegetation; How radar builds an image, data properties, unique challenges of radar, geometric distortions; How to find and process data (practical session); Sentinel-1 (SAR) processing for flood mapping, using satellite surveillance to support compliance and enforcement, examples of radar remote sensing in Natural Resources Wales (NRW).
6. Radio Occultation (RO) method for remote sensing of the atmosphere and ionosphere (3 weeks – 9 hours) – Elaboration, direct and inverse problems of radio occultation remote sensing, Radio-Holographic methods for solution of the RO inversion problem, results of RO investigation of the earth’s atmosphere, RO monitoring of the lower Ionosphere, expending applicable domain of RO technique.
content.ch:
1. 雷達系統簡介
2. 目標雷達截面與噪聲和脈沖壓縮中的訊號檢測
3. 雷達天線、雷達雜波和箔條
4. 訊號處理 - MTI 和脈衝多普勒技術、跟蹤和參數估計、發射器和接收器
5. 了解和使用合成孔徑雷達 (SAR) 資料
6. 用於遙測大氣和電離層的無線電掩星 (RO) 方法
